case_vignette: A 30-year-old man who was recently placed on TMP-SMX for a urinary tract infection presents to urgent care with a new rash. The vital signs include: blood pressure 121/80 mm Hg, pulse 91/min, respiratory rate 18/min, and temperature 36.7°C (98.2°F). Physical examination reveals a desquamative skin covering both of his lower extremities. A basic chemistry panel reveal sodium 139 mmol/L, potassium 3.8 mmol/L, chloride 110 mmol/L, carbon dioxide 47, blood urea nitrogen 23 mg/dL, creatinine 0.9 mg/dL, and glucose 103 mg/dL.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've developed a new rash on both of my lower legs.
When did you first notice the rash?
I recently started taking medication for a urinary tract infection and noticed the rash after that.
What medication were you prescribed for the urinary tract infection?
I was prescribed TMP-SMX for my urinary tract infection.
Have you ever had a similar rash in the past?
No, I have not had a similar rash before.
Is the rash itchy or painful?
The rash isn't itchy or painful.
Are there any other symptoms, like fever, joint pain, or swelling associated with the rash?
I don't have a fever, joint pain, or swelling with the rash.
How long after starting the TMP-SMX did the rash appear?
The rash appeared after I was recently placed on the TMP-SMX.
Does the rash blanch when you press on it?
I haven't tried that, so I'm not sure if the rash blanches when pressed.
Is the rash localized to your lower legs or has it spread to other areas of your body?
The rash is just on both of my lower legs.
Have you had any previous allergic reactions to medications?
I have not had allergic reactions to medications in the past.
Does your family have a history of skin conditions or drug allergies?
I don't know of any family history of skin conditions or drug allergies.
Final Diagnosis: Drug-induced rash secondary to TMP-SMX (Trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole).

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've come in because I've developed a new rash on my skin.
What does the rash look like?
The skin on both of my lower legs is peeling off.
Are you experiencing any other symptoms like fever, joint pain, or swelling?
No, I don't have any fever, joint pain, or swelling.
How long have you had this rash?
This rash just started after I began taking medication for a urinary infection.
What medication did you start taking for your urinary infection?
I started taking TMP-SMX for the urinary tract infection.
Are you experiencing any itching or burning sensation on the rash?
No, I'm not feeling any itching or burning sensation on the rash.
Do you have a history of allergies or allergic reactions to medications?
I don't know; I've never had an allergic reaction to medications before.
Have you experienced any recent changes in your soap, detergents, or skincare products that might cause contact dermatitis?
No, I haven't changed any soaps, detergents, or skincare products recently.
Do you have a family history of skin conditions, such as psoriasis or eczema?
I'm not sure about my family's history with skin conditions.
Is the skin peeling associated with areas of redness or lesions, or does it appear to be only skin shedding?
It's just the skin peeling off, no redness or lesions.
Have you noticed any improvement or worsening of the rash since you started medication?
The rash started after I began the medication; it's a new issue.

Considering the temporal relation between the initiation of TMP-SMX therapy and the onset of the skin peeling without other systemic symptoms or signs of an allergic reaction, and in the absence of any other identifiable cause, this could be a reaction to the medication.

**Final Diagnosis:** Adverse drug reaction likely secondary to TMP-SMX.
